intro: Lepidium capitatum, commonly known as peppergrass, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in a dense, club-shaped inflorescence at the top of the stem. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a slight pubescence. Lepidium capitatum is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
